response:
Multifocal CNS signs in a 27-year-old with optic neuritis and cerebellar/pyramidal involvement most strongly suggest an inflammatory demyelinating disorder; alternatives include other demyelinating antibodies and inflammatory/infectious mimics.

differential_diagnosis = ["Relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis", "Myelin oligodendrocyte glycoprotein antibody-associated disease (MOGAD)", "Neuromyelitis optica spectrum disorder (AQP4-IgG positive)", "CNS sarcoidosis", "Primary CNS vasculitis", "Vitamin B12 deficiency", "Ischaemic cerebellar stroke"]
